Name.BusinessNameLine1: ERNEST GALLO CLINIC AND RESEARCH CENTER

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Research relating to alcoholism, substance abuse and related conditions.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Research relating to alcoholism, substance abuse and related conditions.
IRS990.Description: Medical Research, General/Other: The work of the Ernest Gallo Clinic and Research Center is intended to lead to an understanding of the neurological effects of ethanol and substances of abuse. Long-term objectives include blocking and reversing the effects of alcohol and substances of abuse in the brain and identifying individuals at risk of developing alcohol and substance use disorders. Several research projects are currently in progress and are being funded principally by grants from the State of California, the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), the National Institute of Drug Abuse (NIDA), the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS), the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH), and the U.S. Department of Defense. Gallo Center faculty also participate in the teaching program of the University of California, San Francisco. (66 Publications)

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Center had no unrecognized tax benefits or uncertain tax positions for the years ended June 30, 2010 and 2009, respectively.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: On occasion the organization will pay a nominal fee to upgrade business flights to FIRST CLASS to obtain the additional space necessary for work during cross-country flights.
John Kaso received a one-time severance payment of $79,825 on 1/16/09.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MARY C. GALLO IS JOSEPH E. GALLO'S SISTER-IN-LAW.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The description of the purpose of the corporation and the irrevocable dedication of the property of the corporation were amended to make the corporation eligible for the "welfare exemption" from property taxes.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CENTER HAS TWO MEMBERS: MARY C. GALLO AND JOSEPH E. GALLO. THE CENTER HAS NO STOCKHOLDERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A - THE CENTER'S MEMBERS ELECT ITS BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Three weeks before the filing deadline, the Center's Chief Administrative Officer provided all Board Members an electronic copy of the draft Form 990 for their review.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Center management monitors potential conflicts of interest through regular communication with interested persons.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: PURSUANT TO OUR INTERNAL POLICY, THE COMPENSATION OF OUR PRESIDENT AND OUR CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER IS REVIEWED BY OUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS CONSISTS OF PERSONS WHO HAVE NO CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH REGARD TO THE COMPENSATION OF THESE OFFICERS. COMPENSATION DATA FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS, PROVIDED FOR SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS UNDER SIMILAR CIRCUMSTANCES, WERE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD. THE PROCESS, DISCUSSION, AND OUTCOMES OF SUCH REVIEW WERE DOCUMENTED CONTEMPORANEOUSLY. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2008.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The center does not make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, or financial statements available to the public.
